overview_summary: None of these five adjacent landowners has a documented public stance on development or clean energy at this time. One neighbor (Michael and Tambra Bain) holds multiple parcels and is a notable landowner, while the others have limited public profiles. Influence levels skew low, with only one medium-influence landowner and no clear high-influence community leaders among them.

neighbors.name: Michael Cecil & Tambra Lynn Bain
neighbors.claims: Michael C. Bain, approximately 60 years old, is a resident landowner in Flat Rock, Alabama ([veripages.com](https://veripages.com/name/Mike/Bain/#:~:text=,20%20Madison%2C%20AL%20View%20More)). He and his wife Tambra Lynn Bain are listed as owners of multiple parcels in Jackson County property records ([www.revenue.alabama.gov](https://www.revenue.alabama.gov/property-tax/county-offices-appraisal-assessment-records/#:~:text=Scottsboro%2C%20AL%2035768%20Visit%20Jackson,for%20Appraisal%20%26%20Assessment%20Records)). No meeting minutes or local news reports were found in which the Bains have spoken about development or energy projects ([www.jacksoncountyal.gov](https://www.jacksoncountyal.gov/294/Agendas-Minutes#:~:text=Skip%20to%20Main%20Content%20Create,Agendas%20%26%20Minutes%20View%20Most)) ([jacksoncountyal.gov](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/239/Commission#:~:text=Skip%20to%20Main%20Content%20Create,billnance%40jcch.net)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected agricultural community member reach out to discuss the project, highlighting how it addresses farmland concerns and respects local land use.

neighbors.name: Monica Hernandez
neighbors.claims: Monica Hernandez is recorded as a property owner in the Flat Rock area of Jackson County (per county tax parcel records) ([www.revenue.alabama.gov](https://www.revenue.alabama.gov/property-tax/county-offices-appraisal-assessment-records/#:~:text=Scottsboro%2C%20AL%2035768%20Visit%20Jackson,for%20Appraisal%20%26%20Assessment%20Records)). There is no public record of her participating in local government meetings or voicing opinions on development issues ([www.jacksoncountyal.gov](https://www.jacksoncountyal.gov/294/Agendas-Minutes#:~:text=Skip%20to%20Main%20Content%20Create,Agendas%20%26%20Minutes%20View%20Most)). Her profile in community organizations or media is minimal, suggesting she has no known civic roles or public statements on these matters ([jacksoncountyal.gov](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/239/Commission#:~:text=Skip%20to%20Main%20Content%20Create,billnance%40jcch.net)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach one-on-one in a friendly manner to build trust. Emphasize how the project will maintain neighborhood peace and property upkeep, addressing any personal concerns she might have.

neighbors.name: Trevor Newsom
neighbors.claims: Trevor Newsom owns property in the vicinity of the project site in Flat Rock, Jackson County (per county assessor records) ([www.revenue.alabama.gov](https://www.revenue.alabama.gov/property-tax/county-offices-appraisal-assessment-records/#:~:text=Scottsboro%2C%20AL%2035768%20Visit%20Jackson,for%20Appraisal%20%26%20Assessment%20Records)). No references to Trevor Newsom appear in local news or Jackson County public meeting archives, indicating he has not taken a public position on development issues ([www.jacksoncountyal.gov](https://www.jacksoncountyal.gov/294/Agendas-Minutes#:~:text=Skip%20to%20Main%20Content%20Create,Agendas%20%26%20Minutes%20View%20Most)). He does not hold any known public office or leadership roles in the community as of the latest records ([jacksoncountyal.gov](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/239/Commission#:~:text=Skip%20to%20Main%20Content%20Create,billnance%40jcch.net)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through a casual, neighborly conversation. Address practical topics like property values and safety to connect with his likely interests as a homeowner.

neighbors.name: Amber Haley Gray Smith & Dillion Lee Smith
neighbors.claims: Amber Haley Gray Smith and Dillion Lee Smith are a married couple listed as joint property owners in Flat Rock, Jackson County ([www.revenue.alabama.gov](https://www.revenue.alabama.gov/property-tax/county-offices-appraisal-assessment-records/#:~:text=Scottsboro%2C%20AL%2035768%20Visit%20Jackson,for%20Appraisal%20%26%20Assessment%20Records)). They have not been identified in any local civic roles or public meetings related to development, and no statements from them on such issues are documented in news sources ([www.jacksoncountyal.gov](https://www.jacksoncountyal.gov/294/Agendas-Minutes#:~:text=Skip%20to%20Main%20Content%20Create,Agendas%20%26%20Minutes%20View%20Most)). Their community profile is private, with no known advocacy or opposition recorded regarding land use changes ([jacksoncountyal.gov](https://jacksoncountyal.gov/239/Commission#:~:text=Skip%20to%20Main%20Content%20Create,billnance%40jcch.net)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out to the Smiths informally, possibly through a community gathering or neighbor introduction. Emphasize how the project will preserve neighborhood character and address any quality-of-life questions they may have.
